If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.27-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1187/41236875/940181624?q=report+fields&issue_type=jira **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1897@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Have two accounts opened on two different devices or environments Prerequisite 2: User A has at least one workspace available 1. Open the Expensify app 2. Navigate to "Workspaces" 3. Open any workspace and tap on "Reports" 4. Enable report fields 5. Upgrade the workspace type if necessary 6. Add a new field of any type. (For example: Text) 7. Navigate to workspace chat 8. Invite User B as member of the chat 9. Create a new manual expense 10. Open the just created expense 11. Note that created report field, is visible on top of report 12. As User B, open the report of the expense created by User A 13. Note that report field is not visible on top of report ## Expected Result: Added report fields and all the expense details should be visible on top of report on workspace member´s side ## Actual Result: Added report fields are not visible on top of report on workspace member´s side ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] Investigate multiple calls to Search

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem We have several logs where calls to the Search API are triggered within milliseconds of each other. In a particular instance, it was triggered 7 times within 2s. The logs above all show the `Reports > To-do > Approve` query to be triggered multiple times ### Solution We need to solve this as Search is a slow command and this is bad for performance. Investigate what's causing App to trigger multiple Search calls

title: [$250] [CFI] Add group-by report layout feature

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1759861399608339), we've received feedback from NewDot customers that they miss the OldDot report view where we group report expenses by category into distinct sections and show category-specific totals. We're thinking we can do this by adding a `Report layout` option in the `More` menu of a report. Notes on it: - This should only apply to reports with **more than** 1 expense—we don't want to touch the single-expense view - Tapping it would open the option to group by category, tag, or none. - I expect none would remain the default. - The selection would be sticky across reports. - We're also discussing a "split by" section that allows you to further organize reports by reimbursable/non-reimbursable expenses (shown in the mock below), but we are thinking we can skip implementing that for now and add it later if we see demand for it. **Future RHP with Group by and Split by options:** ### Mocks for implementation now **Menu:** **Report layout RHP:** **Group by category:** **A few specs to help with the headers:** **Bulk selecting a group (works the exact same as it does today, just with the added checkbox control in the group header):** **Mobile:** **Mobile specs:** cc @Expensify/product-pr @Expensify/design
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~021975924282133236969
  • Upwork Job ID: 1975924282133236969
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-10-08
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @shubham1206agra

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.27-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1187/folder/13176877/41237352/940181933 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1897@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has a Self DM. Prerequisite 2: Account has at least one workspace with delayed submissions and approvals enabled. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Create a manual expense and submit it to Self DM. 3. Navigate to "Reports" > "Expenses" 4. Open the just created expense. 5. Tap on "More" > "View Details" 6, Tap on "Submit it to someone" 7. Select any workspace and complete creation flow. 8. Once redirected to details page again, return to "Reports" > "Expenses" 9. Note that expense preview shows "View" button instead of "Submit" 10. Navigate to chat. 11. Note that expense preview shows "Submit" button. ## Expected Result: "Submit" button should be visible on track expense preview on "Reports" after being moved to a workspace from the details page. ## Actual Result: After moving a track expense to a workspace while on"Expenses" section on "Reports", preview shows "View" button instead of "Submit". "Submit" button is visible on preview on chat. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/380c3fe3-d3e6-469f-abad-d6d9c659e96a [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Migrate an existing user to New Expensify 2. After migration completes, open ToDo > Submit list 3. Observe that multiple reports appear in the list 4. Note that some reports don’t display the “Submit” button on the list view 5. Click into one of those reports 6. The Submit button appears inside the report view ## Expected Result: Only reports requiring submission should appear in ToDo > Submit. title: [$250] Expense - Track expense is moved to Self DM again after being submitted to WS while offline.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.27-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1187/folder/13176877/41237365/940181942 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1897@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has a Self DM. Prerequisite 2: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Turn off internet connection. 3. Create a manual expense and submit it to Self DM. 4. Once redirected to chat, tap on "Submit it to someone" 5. Select any workspace and complete creation flow. 6. Tap on the back button on the top left corner to return to Self DM. 7. Note that expense submitted to workspace, is still visible but with a strikethrough. 8. Navigate to the workspace where expense was submitted. 9. Open the expense report. 10. Turn on internet connection. 11. Note that infinite loading is displayed. 12. Tap on back button on the top left corner to return to chat. 13. Note that report is now displayed empty. 14. Return to Self DM. 15. Note that expense is displayed again on Self DM. 16. Open expense. 17. Note that system message about expense being moved to report on workspace, is still visible. ## Expected Result: Track expense submitted to workspace while offline, should remain on the workspace when recovering internet connection. ## Actual Result: When user moved a track expense to a workspace while offline and recovers internet connection on report, infinite loading is displayed, and also, when returning to chat, expense disappears from report and is moved to Self DM again automatically. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/af6a752c-ac42-4c6f-89d5-2d92f06e2070 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$125] [Translation Migration] Fix split or incomplete translations in scheduledCall

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Problem This batch contains incomplete translations that need to be migrated to use translation parameters instead of split keys or trailing spaces. ## Translation Keys to Fix - `scheduledCall.book.slots` - Current value: `"Available times for "` ## Example PRs See these PRs for examples of how to perform this migration: - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/54544 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/54545 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70523 More examples can be found in the tracking issue: https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/62808 ## Migration Steps 1. Identify where these translation keys are used in the codebase 2. Combine split translations (keys containing "part") into single translation strings with parameters 3. Remove trailing spaces from translation values and combine them properly with whatever rich text content is displayed after them in the app 4. Update the code to pass the appropriate parameters to the translation function, usually wrapping rich text with react-native-render-html as seen in the example PRs 5. Test the changes to ensure the translations render correctly
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @

labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Problem This batch contains incomplete translations that need to be migrated to use translation parameters instead of split keys or trailing spaces. ## Translation Keys to Fix - `contacts.helpTextBeforeEmail` - Current value: `"Add more ways for people to find you, and forward receipts to "` ## Example PRs See these PRs for examples of how to perform this migration: - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/54544 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/54545 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70523 More examples can be found in the tracking issue: https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/62808 ## Migration Steps 1. Identify where these translation keys are used in the codebase 2. Combine split translations (keys containing "part") into single translation strings with parameters 3. Remove trailing spaces from translation values and combine them properly with whatever rich text content is displayed after them in the app 4. Update the code to pass the appropriate parameters to the translation function, usually wrapping rich text with react-native-render-html as seen in the example PRs 5. Test the changes to ensure the translations render correctly
